page.description: Fetch data to a property array using a SQL query.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ToPropertyArray(SQLStatement as C [, Arguments as SQL::Arguments,] Array as p[] [, RowsToCopy = -1 as N [, StartRow = 1 as N ]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: SQLStatement
argument.description: The SQL query that selects the data to retrieve.

argument.name: Arguments
argument.description: Optional. A SQL::Arguments object. One or more arguments to be resolved when the SELECT statement is executed.

argument.name: Array
argument.description: Pointer array to receive the retrieved data.

argument.name: RowsToCopy = -1
argument.description: Optional. Default = -1 (all). The number of rows to copy.

argument.name: StartRow = 1
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1 (first). The first row to copy.

section.note: You must dim the array first: DIM MyArray[1] as P

section.description: The ToPropertyArray() method fetches the results of the query to the DataArray property array. The property array will be initialized with columns matching the names of the fields retrieved.

section.title: Example
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim connString as C dim query as C dim args as SQL::Arguments dim array0 as P dim results as C query = "select firstname, lastname from customer where lastname > 'm'" connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" if .not. conn.open(connString) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if if .not. conn.ToPropertyArray(query, args, array, 5, 3) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if results = property_to_string(array) ui_msg_box("Results", results) conn.close()
